head.note: This manuscript record does not have a summary list of contents. For composite manuscripts, the list of contents can be found under each individual part.

listRelation.desc: This composite manuscript consists of 2 distinct parts:

altIdentifier.collection: William Wright, Catalogue of the Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838
William Wright, Catalogue of the Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

head.note: This manuscript contains: Extracts from the Lives of the Egyptian Fathers; Isaiah of Scete. Numerous selections and extracts from the works of Isaiah of Scete; Abraham Nephtarenus. Discourses of Abraham Nephtarenus; John the monk. Discourses of John the monk; Jacob of Batnae. Prose homily of Jacob of Batnae on the Nativity; .... In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 24 items.

msItem.incipit: ܢܣܝܡ ܢܝܫܐ ܕܣܒܪܐ ܕܐܠܗܐ ܩܕܡ ܥܝ̈ܢܝ̣ܢ ܒܣܘܟܝܐ ܕܡܬܝܬܗ ܕܡܚܝܢܢ. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.author: Ephraim
msItem.title: Extract from a discourse of Ephraim, on the warfare withSatan
msItem.incipit: ܚ̇ܘܣ ܡܪܢ ܥܠ ܐܢܫܘܬܢ: ܕܣ̇ܓܝ ܦܫܝܩܐ ܡܦܘܠܬܗ̇. ܕܠܐ ܢܬܟ̇ܫܠܘܢ ܦܪ̈ܘܫܐ: ܡܐ ܕܩ̇ܪܝܢ ܒܚܘܒܐ ܡ̈ܠܝ. ܏ܘܫ.

physDesc.p: Vellum, about 6 7/8 in. by 5, consisting of 79 leaves, many of which are much stained and torn, especially foll. 1—19, 50, 78, and 79. The quires, signed with letters, were originally at least ten in number, of which the first and last are wanting, and the second has lost its first leaf. There are from 22 to 30 lines in each page. This manuscript is written by two hands (foll. 1—49 and 50—79), in a good regular character of the xth cent.

collation.p: The quires, signed with letters, were originally at least ten in number, of which the first and last are wanting, and the second has lost its first leaf.

item.p: The manuscript consists of 79 leaves, many of which are much stained and torn, especiallyfoll. 1—19, 50, 78, and 79.The second quire has lost its first leaf.

layout.p: There are from 22 to 30 lines in each page.

handNote.desc: This manuscript is written by two hands, this spanningfoll. 1—49, in a good regular character of the xth cent.
This manuscript is written by two hands, this spanningfoll. 50—79, in a good regular character of the xth cent.

William Wright, Catalogue of the Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

head.note: This manuscript contains: John the Monk. A paraenetic discourse of John the Monk; Extracts from the Lives of the Egyptian Eathers; Ephraim. Two discourses of Ephraim on the Mercy of the Most High; Select sayings of the Philosophers regarding upright conduct; Counsels of the Philosophers; .... In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 18 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.author: John the Monk
msItem.title: A paraenetic discourse of John the Monk
Extracts from the Lives of the Egyptian Eathers
msItem.rubric: ܫܘ̈ܐܠܐ ܘܦܘܫ̈ܩܐ ܕܡܪܬܝܢܘܬܐ ܕܐܒ̈ܗܬܐ ܡܨܪ̈ܝܐ ܕܗ̣ܘܘ ܝܚܝ̈ܕܝܐ ܓܡܝܪ̈ܐ.

msItem.author: Ephraim
msItem.title: Two discourses of Ephraim on the Mercy of the Most High
msItem.note: See Add. 14,613, fol. 182b and Overbeck, S. Ephraemi Syri etc. Opera Se¬lecta, p. 105.

msItem.title: Select sayings of the Philosophers regarding upright conduct
msItem.rubric: ܡ̈ܠܐ ܡܓܒ̈ܝܬܐ ܕܦܝܠܣ̈ܦܐ ܕܥܠ ܕܘܒܪ̈ܐ ܕܬܩܢܘܬܐ
msItem.note: See Sachau in the Hermes for 1869, Bd. iv., p. 72 and Sachau, Inedita Syriaca (Wien, 1870), p.ܦ5 c.

msItem.author: Isocrates
msItem.title: Isocrates
msItem.incipit: ܡܢ ܩܕܡ ܟܠܡܕܡ܆ ܢ̇ܗܘܐ ܒܛܝܠ ܠܟ ܥܠ ܐܠܗܐ. ܕܠܗ ܬܦܠܘܚ̣ ܘܩܕܡܘܗܝ ܬܣܓܘܕ. ܏ܘܫ.
msItem.note: See Add. 14,658, fol. 155 a , and 14,620, fol. 2 a .

msItem.author: Menander the Sage
msItem.title: Menander the Sage
msItem.incipit: ܡܢ ܩܕܡ ܟܠܡܕܡ̣ ܠܐܠܗܐ ܕܚ̣ܠ. ܘܠܡ̇ܢ ܕܩܫܝܫ ܡܢܟ̣ ܝܩܪ. ܕܗܟܢܐ ܬܬܝܩܪ ܡܢ ܐܠܗܐ. ܏ܘܫ.
msItem.note: Compare Land, Anecd. Syr., t. i., p. 64.

msItem.title: Sayings of the Sages
msItem.incipit: ܥܢܕܝܢ ܒܪܝ ܚ̈ܝܐ ܕܒܢ̈ܝܢܫܐ ܡܢ ܥܠܡܐ. ܘܬܫܒܚ̈ܬܗܘܢ ܘܛܝ̈ܒܘܬܗܘܢ̣ ܠܥܠܡ ܡܩ̈ܘܝܢ. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.title: Counsels of the Philosophers
msItem.incipit: ܦܝܠܛܘܢ ܡܦܩܕ ܗܘܐ ܠܛܠܝ̈ܐ̣. ܕܗܠܝܢ ܬܠܬ ܨܒ̈ܘ̣ܢ ܟܠܥܕܢ ܢܗ̇ܘܝܢ ܫܟܝܚܢ ܠܘܬܗܘܢ. ܕܗܘ̣ܐ ܙܗ̣ܐ ܪܥܝܢܗܘܢ. ܘܕܗܘ̣ܐ ܫܠ̣ܐ ܠܫܢܗܘܢ. ܘܕܗܘܘ ܢܟܦ̣ܝܢ ܒܚܙܬܗܘܢ܀ ܏ܘܫ.
msItem.note: See Sachau, Inedita Syriaca, p. ܦܒ .

msItem.title: Sayings ofPlato
Advice ofPlatoto his disciple
msItem.incipit: ܠܡܐ ܥܣܩܐ ܒܥܝ̈ܢܝܟ: ܐܘ ܟܪܝܐ ܠܟ ܒܪܝ ܕܡ̇ܦܩܕ ܐܢܐ ܠܟ܆ ܕܐܦ ܟܕ ܕܡܝܟ ܐܢܬ ܠܐ ܬܫܠܐ ܡܢ ܒܥܘܬܐ܀ ܬܠܡܝܕܐ ܐܡ̇ܪ. ܘ̇ܐܝܟܢܐ ܬܗܘܐ ܗܕܐ̇. ܕܗܐ ܡܐ ܕܕܡܝܟ ܐܢܐ ܠܡܝܬܐ ܗܘ ܕܡ̇ܐ ܐܢܐ. ܐ̇ܝܟܢܐ ܐܒܥܐ ܟܕ ܕܡܝܟ ܐܢܐ܀
msItem.note: See Add. 14,618, no. 9, Add. 14,658, no. 24, and Sachau, Ined. Syr., p. ܣܙ .

msItem.title: Sayings regarding the soul
msItem.incipit: ܦܠܛ̇ܘܢ ܐܡ̇ܪ. ܚܝ̈ܝܗ̇ ܕܢܦܫܐ̣. ܒܣܘܥܪ̈ܢܐ ܗܘ ܕܢܦܫܐ ܩܝܡܝܢ. ܟܕ ܢܗܘܘܢ ܢܛܝܪܝܢ ܡܢ ܢܟܝ̈ܢܐ̇. ܕܠܐ ܢܩܪܘܒ ܠܗܘܢ ܡܕܡ ܕܡܫ̣ܟܚ ܩܛ̇ܠ ܠܗܘܢ. ܡܛܠ ܕܐܠܐ ܩܛܠܬ ܗ̣ܝ ܠܗ̣̇. ܠܝܬ ܡܕܡ ܕܡܫ̣ܟܚ ܩ̇ܛܠ ܠܗ̇. ܡܛܠ ܕܪܡܐ ܗ̣ܝ ܘܡܥܠܝܐ ܡܢ ܦܓܪܐ. ܘܒܝܬ ܪ̈ܘܚܢܝܬܐ ܗܝ. ܘܐܦܠܐ ܗ̣ܘ ܡܘܬܐ ܕܕܒܪ ܠܦܓܪܐ ܡܫ̣ܟܚ ܚ̇ܙܝܐ ܠܗ̇. ܡܛܠ ܕܩܛܝܢܐ ܗܝ ܡܢܗ
msItem.note:
The names cited are—
ܦܠܛ̇ܘܢ
Plato
Fol. 119 a
ܬܐܦܪܣܛܘܣ
Theophrastus
Fol. 119 b
ܡܢܕܪܘܣ
Menander
Fol. 119 b
ܩ̇ܪܛܣ
Krts (Crates? Critias? Criton?)
Fol. 120 a
ܛܝܡܟܣ
Timachus (Timarchus ?)
Fol. 120 a
ܬܐܩܪܝܕܣ
Theocritus
Fol. 120 a
ܐܘܣܠܝܘܣ
Eusalius(?)
Fol. 120 b
ܐܠܟܣܢܕܪܣ ܡܠܟܐ
Alexander the Great
Fol. 120 b

msItem.author: Jacob of Batnae
msItem.title: Canticles of Jacob of Batnae

msItem.author: Jacob of Batnae
msItem.title: On the Resurrection of our Lord
msItem.incipit: ܒܗܢܐ ܝܘܡܐ ܗܐ ܦܨܝ̈ܚܢ ܒܪ̈ܝܬܐ ܘܫܪ̈ܒܬܐ ܟܠܗܝܢ. ܥ̈ܠܝܐ ܒܪܘܡܐ. ܘܬܚ̈ܬܝܐ ܒܥܘܡܩܐ. ܫܡܝܐ ܘܐܪܥܐ ܘܟܠ ܕܒܗܘܢ ܒܩܝܡܬܗ ܕܒܪ ܚܝܐ ܕܝܨܝܢ.܀

msItem.author: Jacob of Batnae
msItem.title: On the Descent of our Lord to Hell
msItem.incipit: ܥܠ ܗܘܐ ܠܫܝܘܠ ܗ̇ܘ ܡܪܐ ܕܥܢܝ̈ܕܐ. ܘܢܚܘ ܨܠܘ̈ܒܐ ܥܠ ܡܘܬܗ ܕܓܢܒܪܐ. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.author: Jacob of Batnae
msItem.title: On the Resurrection of our Lord
msItem.incipit: ܩܡ ܡܢ ܩܒܪܐ ܝܗܘܒܗ ܕܢܘܚܡܐ. ܘܠܐ ܚܙ̣ܐ ܚܒܠܐ ܒܗ̇ܘ ܐܬܪܐ ܕܥܢ̈ܝܕܐ. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.author: Jacob of Batnae
msItem.title: On Repentance
msItem.incipit: ܐ̇ܘ ܬܓܪ̈ܐ ܐܙܕܗܪܘ ܒܓܙܝ̈ܟܘܢ. ܡܢ ܓܝܣܐ ܥܠ.. ܡܠܐ ܬܘ̈ܟܐ. ܕܟܡܐ̈ܢܘܗܝ ܩܛܝܢܝܢ ܐܢܘܢ. ܘܡܪܕܝܬܗ ܬܘܩ̈ܠܬܐ ܡܠܝܐ. ܏ܘܫ

physDesc.p: Vellum, about 6 1/2 in. by 5, consisting of 48 leaves (Add. 14,614, foll. 80—127), a few of which are slightly stained and torn. The quires, signed with letters, are at present 5 in number. Leaves are wanting at the beginning and end, and a single leaf is missing after fol. 82. There are from 19 to 24 lines in each page. This manuscript is written in a neat, regular hand of about the viiith cent.

collation.p: The quires, signed with letters, are at present 5 in number.

item.p: 48 leaves, a few of which are slightly stained and torn. Leaves are wanting at the beginning and end, and a single leaf is missing afterfol. 82.

layout.p: There are from 19 to 24 lines in each page.

handNote.desc: This manuscript is written in a neat, regular hand of about the viiith cent.

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue . abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

interpretation.p: Description is based on Wright's Catalogue without consultation of physical manuscripts. Foliation is approximate. Wright often does not indicate ending folia so those have been assumed based on beginning folia.
Scribal notes which could not be more clearly classified based on Wright's descriptions have been identified as <addition>s whether they occur in the margins or the body of the manuscript.
In general, we have classified as an <msItem> as much of the manuscript contents as possible, including tables of contents and indices.

category.catDesc: Catenae Patrum and Demonstrations against Heresies
Councils of the Church and Ecclesiastical Canons

langUsage.language: Unvocalized Syriac of any variety or period
Arabic Garshuni in Vocalized West Syriac Script
Arabic Garshuni in Vocalized East Syriac Script
